content: Hey all. I attended Redmond DevDays in 2019 and one session I liked as a last-minute change with a gentleman from Microsoft discussing Bias in Training Data for machine learning. I can't find the session info in the agenda or recordings because it was a last minute change. I'm trying to find the speaker's info to connect on a AI Ethics work project. Does anyone have his contact info? TIA
@Gino Canessa any chance you caught it? I must have missed this presentation.
I missed it too, let me ask around and see if I can find someone.
Thanks @Josh Mandel and @Gino Canessa It was in one of the smallest rooms in the back of the building.
Have you tried to find it here: https://www.devdays.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/07/Devdays_program_Redmond_2019-1.pdf? @Nick Blake

Rien Wertheim said:

Have you tried to find it here: https://www.devdays.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/07/Devdays_program_Redmond_2019-1.pdf? Nick Blake

Thanks Rien. I did look at that Agenda PDF handout as well as all the recorded session videos and documents/decks uploaded. I want to say that it was in the Sonora (or maybe Lassen) room. It was a smaller session and the topic changed at the last minute when the original/scheduled presenter couldn't make it to DevDays.
Hello, good day. Is there any discount for past attendees of DevDays? Thank you
Hi Calvin, there is frequent DevDays discount. If you send an email to devdays@fire.ly and mention which DevDays you have attended a discount code will be sent to you.
